claims: Cancer patients with pain showed significantly lower levels of role functioning (P < 0.001), emotional functioning (P = 0.014) and global quality of life (P < 0.0001) compared to patients without pain.
Patients in the pain group had significantly higher levels of depressive symptoms than patients in the pain-free group (P < 0.0001).
Pain consistency was significantly correlated with depression (r = 0.32, P = 0.001) and global quality of life (r = -0.31, P = 0.002)

   - Emotional functioning: p < 0.001 (note: this differs slightly from what's stated in the text)
   - Global quality of life: p < 0.001
4. Since this is a compound claim about multiple measures, I should choose one specific aspect to focus on
5. I'll focus on role functioning since it's listed first in both the claim and the table
6. The claim appears in the text on page 3 of the PDF, in the "Results" section under "Functioning, global quality of life, and depression"
claims_all.specific_choice: Cancer patients with pain showed significantly lower levels of role functioning compared to patients without pain
